sen.j: 三代目 尾上 多賀之丞（さんだいめ おのえ たがのじょう、明治22年（1889年）9月21日 - 昭和53年（1978年）6月20日）は、戦前戦後にかけて活躍した歌舞伎役者。
sen.e: Taganojo ONOE the third (Sep 21, 1889 - June 20, 1978) was a Kabuki actor who was popular around the World War II.
Taganojo ONOE the third (Sep 21, 1889 - June 20, 1978) was a Kabuki actor who was popular around the World War II.
Taganojo ONOE the third (Sep 21, 1889 - June 20, 1978) was a Kabuki actor who was popular around the World War II.

sen.j: 本名は樋口 鬼三郎。
sen.e: His real name was Kisaburo HIGUCHI.
His real name was Kisaburo HIGUCHI.
His real name was Kisaburo HIGUCHI.
His Haimyo (Kabuki actor's offstage name) was Baika.
His Haimyo (Kabuki actor's offstage name) was Baika.
His Haimyo (Kabuki actor's offstage name) was Baika.
His trade name was Otowaya.
His trade name was Otowaya.
His trade name was Otowaya.

sen.j: 叔父は歌舞伎役者淺尾工左衛門。
sen.e: His uncle was a Kabuki actor, Kuzaemon ASAO.
His uncle was a Kabuki actor, Kuzaemon ASAO.
His uncle was a Kabuki actor, Kuzaemon ASAO.

sen.j: 役者としての初舞台は明治24年 (1891)、市川鬼三郎の名前で東京四谷江戸三座『鈴木主水噂新宿』（鈴木主水）。
sen.e: He made a debut in "Suzuki Mondo Uwasa Sinjuku" (Suzuki Mondo) under the stage name, Kisaburo ICHIKAWA at Tokyo Yotsuya Edo Sanza in 1891.
He made a debut in "Suzuki Mondo Uwasa Sinjuku" (Suzuki Mondo) under the stage name, Kisaburo ICHIKAWA at Tokyo Yotsuya Edo Sanza in 1891.
He made a debut in "Suzuki Mondo Uwasa Sinjuku" (Suzuki Mondo) under the stage name, Kisaburo ICHIKAWA at Tokyo Yotsuya Edo Sanza in 1891.

sen.j: 明治44年 (1911) 9月五代目市川鬼丸を襲名し名題に昇進。
sen.e: In September 1911, he succeeded to the name, Kigan ICHIKAWA (the fifth) and became a chief actor.
In September 1911, he succeeded to the name, Kigan ICHIKAWA (the fifth) and became a chief actor.
In September 1911, he succeeded to the name, Kigan ICHIKAWA (the fifth) and became a chief actor.

sen.j: 以後小芝居で花形役者として活躍するが、その才能を尾上菊五郎 (6代目)に見出された。
sen.e: He had been a top-billed actor in Koshibai until Kikugoro ONOE (the sixth) spotted his talent.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He had been a top-billed actor in Koshibai until Kikugoro ONOE (the sixth) spotted his talent.
He had been a top-billed actor in Koshibai until Kikugoro ONOE (the sixth) spotted his talent.

sen.j: 大正10年 (1921) 菊五郎一座に客分として入座、市村座の『網模様燈篭菊桐』（小猿七之）の滝川。
sen.e: Then he joined Kikugoro's troupe as a guest and played the role of Takigawa in "Amimoyo Toronokikukiri" (Kozaru Shichinosuke) at the Ichimura-za theater in 1921.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Then he joined Kikugoro's troupe as a guest and played the role of Takigawa in "Amimoyo Toronokikukiri" (Kozaru Shichinosuke) at the Ichimura-za theater in 1921.
Then he joined Kikugoro's troupe as a guest and played the role of Takigawa in "Amimoyo Toronokikukiri" (Kozaru Shichinosuke) at the Ichimura-za theater in 1921.

sen.j: 昭和2年 (1927) 新橋演舞場の『厄年』のいろは茶屋お六で三代目尾上多賀之丞を襲名する。
sen.e: He succeeded to the name, Taganojo ONOE (the third) when playing the role of Iroha Chaya Oroku in "Yakudoshi" at the Shinbashi Enbujo theater in 1927.
He succeeded to the name, Taganojo ONOE (the third) when playing the role of Iroha Chaya Oroku in "Yakudoshi" at the Shinbashi Enbujo theater in 1927.
He succeeded to the name, Taganojo ONOE (the third) when playing the role of Iroha Chaya Oroku in "Yakudoshi" at the Shinbashi Enbujo theater in 1927.

sen.j: 昭和53年 (1978) 2月、数え90歳で『かっぽれ』を躍ったのを名残に没した。
sen.e: In February 1978, he passed away after dancing "Kappore" in his 90th year.
In February 1978, he passed away after dancing "Kappore" in his 90th year.
In February 1978, he passed away after dancing "Kappore" in his 90th year.

sen.j: 女形の名脇役であった。
sen.e: He was notable as oyama (actor of female roles) of supporting roles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was notable as oyama (actor of female roles) of supporting roles.
He was notable as oyama (actor of female roles) of supporting roles.

sen.j: 六代目菊五郎から、尾上松緑 (2代目)、尾上梅幸 (7代目)を経て尾上菊五郎 (7代目)と、音羽屋三代の相方を勤める。
sen.e: He played the roles of aikata (key supporting role) for three generations of Otowaya's star actors: Shoroku ONOE (the second), Baiko ONOE (the seventh), and Kikugoro ONOE (the seventh).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He played the roles of aikata (key supporting role) for three generations of Otowaya's star actors: Shoroku ONOE (the second), Baiko ONOE (the seventh), and Kikugoro ONOE (the seventh).
He played the roles of aikata (key supporting role) for three generations of Otowaya's star actors: Shoroku ONOE (the second), Baiko ONOE (the seventh), and Kikugoro ONOE (the seventh).

sen.j: 晩年は後進の指導に当っていた。
sen.e: He coached younger actors in his later years.
He coached younger actors in his later years.
He coached younger actors in his later years.

sen.j: 『暗闇の丑松』のお今、『ひらかな盛衰記・源太勘当』の延寿、『梅雨小袖昔八丈』（髪結新三）の後家お常など新作や時代物、世話物などに名演技を示した。
sen.e: He made excellent performances in new works, Jidaimono (historical drama), and Sewamono (play dealing with the lives of ordinary people), by playing the roles of Oima in "Kurayamino Ushimatsu", Enju in "Hirakana Seisuiki Genta Kando," and widow Otsune in "Tsuyukosode Mukashi Hachijo" (Kamiyui Shinza.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He made excellent performances in new works, Jidaimono (historical drama), and Sewamono (play dealing with the lives of ordinary people), by playing the roles of Oima in "Kurayamino Ushimatsu", Enju in "Hirakana Seisuiki Genta Kando," and widow Otsune in "Tsuyukosode Mukashi Hachijo" (Kamiyui Shinza.)

He made excellent performances in new works, Jidaimono (historical drama), and Sewamono (play dealing with the lives of ordinary people), by playing the roles of Oima in "Kurayamino Ushimatsu", Enju in "Hirakana Seisuiki Genta Kando," and widow Otsune in "Tsuyukosode Mukashi Hachijo" (Kamiyui Shinza.)

sen.j: 中でも『盲長屋梅加賀鳶』（加賀鳶）のおさすりお兼は最大の当り役であった。
sen.e: Above all, Osasuri Okane in "Mekuranagaya Umegakagatobi" (Kagatobi) was his most successful role.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Above all, Osasuri Okane in "Mekuranagaya Umegakagatobi" (Kagatobi) was his most successful role.
Above all, Osasuri Okane in "Mekuranagaya Umegakagatobi" (Kagatobi) was his most successful role.

sen.j: 80代を過ぎても、すっきりした江戸前の伝法さと溢れるばかりの色気とで舞台を彩っていた。
sen.e: He added flair to the stage with his Edomae (Tokyo style) boldness and sex appeal even past his 80s.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He added flair to the stage with his Edomae (Tokyo style) boldness and sex appeal even past his 80s.
He added flair to the stage with his Edomae (Tokyo style) boldness and sex appeal even past his 80s.

sen.j: 昭和43年 (1968)、重要無形文化財保持者（人間国宝）に認定される。
sen.e: In 1968, he was accredited as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure.)
In 1968, he was accredited as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure.)
In 1968, he was accredited as the holder of Important Intangible Cultural Property (Living National Treasure.)
